content.description: An awesome problem on mostly good rock. Sit or squat start more to the right of the giant rail feature. Traverse this large sloping rail left using some trickery until a good incut sidepull pinch is reached. From here a tricky sequence is required in order to reach improving holds. Once to the left corner of the roof, a few more sustained moves bring the climber around and then up a slabby section in order to topout. Kneebars and toe-hooks could prove very useful on the roof part of the climb.
content.protection: 3 or 4 pads and a spotter. Most of the moves can be worked in isolation, and the landing is relatively decent.
content.location: This boulder problem lies on the downhill side of the block, under the large roof.

content.description: Only about fifteen to twenty minutes from the Trail Split, this area has a lot of rock. Some of it is of good quality while others blocks seem to be exfoliating choss. Little has been developed here, and if it has, it is undocumented. The only established and documented line in the area is Jimmy Webb's first ascent named "The Trail of Tiers".
